goals__remit:
WeForest is a Belgian  NGO  and an internatioanl team which focuses on halting global warming through large bio-diverse tree planting projects in tropical countries. Planting trees can halt global warming by restoring the hydrological process of our planet. 
WeForest is contributing in 3 ways:  
1.    Demonstrating it is possible with scalable best practices on the ground (with over 12 million trees to date and capacity and plans for 50 million in the next 4 years). 
2.    Promoting the scientific exchange and dissemination on the dynamics of global hydrology and trees for climate. WeForest is advancing the forest/water-cycle/climate research by organising for example  a high level scientific conference in June 2015 for 40 international researchers with the University of Leuven, Belgium. 
3.    Creating a movement with corporate brands (over 120 to date) who use trees as a currency to engage consumers, drawing on marketing and CSR budgets to Make Earth Cooler.
relevant_communication: Policy brief ( published Sept 2015) with KUL and 40 global scientists on "Why do forest matter for water and climate change? Strategies for sustainability".
